meanings: can bear; be able to fulfill the duties; be fit for [adequate to]; be capable of carrying out [discharging, performing]; deal well with.

examples.korean: affordable prices / housing 발음듣기 감당할 수 있는 가격/주택 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
Can you manage that suitcase? 발음듣기 그 가방 (너 혼자서) 감당할 수 있니? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Can you manage that suitcase? 발음

examples.korean: She felt unequal to the task she had set herself. 발음듣기 그녀는 자신에게 스스로 부과한 과제를 감당할 수 있을 것 같지가 않았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She felt unequal to the task she had set herself. 발음

examples.korean: This will overstretch the prison service’s resources. 발음듣기 이것은 교도소 운영 자원이 감당할 수 있는 것 이상을 요하게 될 것이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: This will overstretch the prison service’s resources. 발음

examples.korean: The transport service cannot cope with the strain of so many additional passengers. 발음듣기 운송 서비스 체제가 그렇게 많은 추가 승객이라는 부담을 감당할 수가 없다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The transport service cannot cope with the strain of so many additional passengers. 발음
